page.title: 01Hury In Baldersdale
page.content: The block covers an area lying between 180m and 400m. The higher parts are used for grazing sheep and shooting grouse. The lower enclosed land has numerous small farms not exceeding 200 acres each. Mainly Friesian cows for milk (northern dairy shorthorn cows are now rarely seen). Charolais cross bred beasts brought on for fat stock. Sheep run on open moor (stinted). Farm life hard. Labour costs high hence long hours for owners or tenants. Cold winters and high rainfall make hay crops difficult hence trend to silage. Hamlets at Hury and Hunderthwaite. Some abandoned buildings and 2 public houses show a decline in rural population. Hury reservoir is public water supply. Used for fishing perch, brown and rainbow trout. Canadian and brent geese sometimes
